amendment.description: To provide that none of the funds appropriated or otherwise made available by this Act may be used to enter into a contract in an amount greater than $5,000,000 or to award a grant in excess of such amount unless the prospective contractor or grantee makes certain certifications regarding Federal tax liability.

vote.text: Amendment SA 2799 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

action.text: Amendment SA 2799 proposed by Senator Murray for Senator Obama. (consideration: CR S11373; text: CR S11373) To provide that none of the funds appropriated or otherwise made available by this Act may be used to enter into a contract in an amount greater than $5,000,000 or to award a grant in excess of such amount unless the prospective contractor or grantee makes certain certifications regarding Federal tax liability.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 2799 proposed by Senator Murray for Senator Obama.
Senate amendment agreed to: Amendment SA 2799 agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.
